inn1.comm: full, well wide of off stump and left alone
full and driven to cover
length outside off and left alone
length on middle and off, flicked into the leg side but too close to midwicket for a single
wide and driven out between point and cover towards the boundary
full and driven to mid on
starts on leg stump and clipped away to long leg, chase round for the deep square fielder
middle and leg and clipped to midwicket
length on off stump and nudged off the back foot to mid on
leg stump, Cook forward meets it on the full but only pushed to midwicket
down the pitch and this time pushed past midwicket with a wristy flick
slides on to off stump and Cook was back and just keeps it out into the off side, we've seen that before
driven down the ground, mid on comes in, could be out, but a fumble and Pietersen gets home by the time the stumps are thrown down, a clean return would have run KP out
full and driven nicely through the covers, classical stuff from Cook, Gnasher suggests whether that's England's first cover drive since September!?! Chortle, chortle
good nut, outside off and beats Cook's prod off the back foot
length and squirted off an outside edge to third man, safely on the ground
length and off stump, Pietersen forward to defend into the off side
Pietersen walks across to the off side, trying to flick to leg and gets hit on the pad
forward on off stump and blocked to short extra cover
swept, struck on the pad, it runs fine, we do have a referral each in this series but Pakistan decline the option
Pietersen now struck on the pad and this is referred by Pakistan...it hit him on the back pad, possibly outside the line...indeed, hitting the pad outside off stump so Pietersen survives
length on off stump and dropped out on the off side
skip down and blocking a ball fired in slightly
skip down and drive out to long on
poor down the leg side and it runs off the pad to the fine leg fence
length ball, Pietersen plays round it, struck on the pad, given out! Pietersen refers it...could be high...and indeed, good review, the ball going clearly over
length and defended into the leg side
whipped from outside off through the leg side, finds the gap between mid on the midwicket, well timed
full on off stump and Pietersen rightly refuses the run having blocked up to mid on
worked off a length in front of square
full and pushed back to the bowler
full and flicked to the right hand of the bowler
fuller of length and pushed to long on
middle and leg and flicked out through square leg
full on middle stump and pushed to midwicket
full and nudged back to the bowler
length outside off and forced into the leg side
shorter outside off and cut to point, mistimed
length and well played, opening the face wide of third man
slower ball, full on middle stump and pushed into the leg side
flicked from just outside off and runs it past midwicket where a labouring Afridi tries to chase it down out to cow corner but can't get there
slower again and blocked on off stump
middle and leg and Pietersen tries to push down the ground but isn't quite to the pitch
this time he gets out enough and runs it down the ground
flicked from a length on off stump to midwicket
cut away finds the gap at point and it races away to the fence, well played by the chef
drifts in to off stump and pushed back to the bowler
length and smashed through the leg side, this was well read and punched wide of mid on
worked off the hip out to deep square
slower and forward on middle and leg, inside edge to square leg
length on off stump and blocked forward
off stump and pushed to mid on standing tall
back of a length on off stump and dropped out on the off side, they refuse a single to point
length and moved from middle and off through the leg side for a couple more
length and Pietersen uses his feet again and to work out to midwicket
length on middle and leg stump and flicked to short square leg
length ball, Cook decides not to sweep and is struck on the pad, out lbw and reviewed, must be bat...yep, he's absolutely nailed it onto his pad, another decision overturned
length and turned to square leg
full outside off and driven to cover
pushed down to long leg
beaten pushing forward outside off
tries to play into the legside but ball pops off a leading edge behind point
turned into the legside
pushing forward out towards deep backward point
defended on his stumps
punched out to the fielder at cover
dances forward but checks a drive back to the bowler
on off stump and driven back to Hafeez again
three in a row - Pietersen punching a straight one back at the bowler
pushed to the fielder at midwicket
out of his crease again but forced to defend
quicker ball, defended into the on side
wide and short, giving Cook plenty of room to swing those forearms and send a lusty cut to the boundary
pushed out toward long-off
outside off, Pietersen gets forward and nudges the ball to the cover man
he's gone! Afridi skids one straight through Pietersen's defences and the England man's comeback as an opener is over. He was caught half-forward and the ball straightened to clatter into off stump

two in two! This time, from wide on the crease, Afridi angles a quicker delivery past Trott's lazy, attempted cover drive and the bails go flying once again! Looked like the googly, the way it came back at Trott
defended on his stumps
defended into the legside
full length, punched down the ground
Bopara is off the mark, nudging the ball off his legs
outside off, Cook goes back and drives out to extra cover
on off stump, defended back to the bowler
was that a stumping chance missed? The ball was down the legside - in fact it went through his legs - and Umar coudn't gather
well down the leg side
flatter, quicker and defended into the off side
pushed towards mid-on and the batsmen scamper through
played up to the fielder at long-off
is that out? It probably should be, having hit Bopara on the back pad right in front - but Pakistan have lost their one review
outside off, played back to Afridi
defended on the stumps
flighted on on off-stump, defended playing forward
tickled off his legs towards midwicket
defended back down the wicket
again, Cook leans forward and defends
keeping a tight line and Cook can't get him away
on his legs but clipped to the fielder at midwicket
lured outside off and beaten by the pace and a little turn
on the stumps this time and defended
check driven square into the offside, reaching for it slightly
outside off, slanting across and played towards cover
on the stumps, defended on the back foot
slanted in towards the batsman, punched back towards Afridi
on off stump, Cook drives out to long-off
fullish delivery on the stumps and Bopara can only chop it into the ground
outside off this time, driven down the ground
aggressively hacked off his legs by Cook but well fielded at midwicket
gets forward and defends into the on side
tries to force the ball off the back foot through midwicket from off stump
punched down the ground for one
slanted across the batsman but sent scurrying back the way it came into the midwicket area
doesn't pick the googly but squirts a single off the inside edge
sent up well outside off but Cook steps out langoriously and slog-sweeps out towards deep midwicket for a one-bounce four
exquisite timing off his legs and the ball races away once again. If donkey's bat like this ...
played back down the ground towards long-on
outside off but tickled towards square leg
again played square into the infield
on the stumps and Cook goes back, chops into the ground
comes forward and drives hard out towards mid-on
on the stumps as ever but Cook works it into the covers
on the stumps, defended back
fizzing outside off and a leading edge squirts short of cover
again goes back to one across him and pushes out towards deep backward point
flat and quick but shovelled into the leg side
angled in and Bopara can only push towards cover
tight line on the stumps and defended
length outside off and dropped out on the off side
pushed away outside off,  a sliding save from point
back of a length outside off and flicked down to mid on
offie and Bopara across and forward to push back to the bowler
press forward outside off and push into the off side
turn into the pads, runs up on the leg side
short outside off and cut off a bottom edge to gully
awful, short and wide and a huge let off for the bowler as Cook cuts straight to cover
fuller on off stump and tucked into the leg side
off stump and Cook eager to come forward to drive, pushes aerially to mid off
slower ball but down the leg side
full and driven out to deep point
poor, leg side and flashed away wide of long leg
length outside off and flicked to long on
turn past the inside edge onto the pad
forward and pressed into the off side
forward on middle and off to defend
down low to paddle sweep, gets it fine
turned down the ground from a full length
clipped off the pads through midwicket
length and angled to third man
clipped to long leg
length and defended from the crease on middle and off
flashed outside off, a real confidence-boosting stroke away past extra cover
same again, smashed through the off side to the same boundary
turned away off the pads
keeps a touch low on off stump and blocked back to the bowler
length and punched down the ground to long on
dropped out on the off side off the back foot
length and played forward into the leg side
swept hard from outside off to deep square leg
cut out through point
fuller on middle and leg and punched to long on
middle stump and worked into the leg side
length and pushed to square leg off the back foot
slides past the outside edge and an appeal for a stumping but Bopara safely back
length on leg stump and well timed out to cow corner, the man from deep square can't get their quickly enough to save three
tossed up outside off, nudged at, comes off the outside edge and runs very fine and all the way for four
dropped into the covers, yes, no, no no! Cook scrambles back but a direct hit to the non-striker's end could have seen him gone
loud cry for leg before, probably sliding down, catching Bopara half way up the front pad,it was going down leg
lovely doosra beats Bopara outside off and beats Akmal too
outside off, cut off a bottom edge to point
connects with the cut to point
full on off stump and driven back to the bowler
leg side, strikes the pad and runs fine, deep backward square comes round to field
off stump and Bopara plays in-to-out quite well, driving to long off's left for a couple
middle and leg, turned through midwicket
length outside off stump and square-driven hard out to deep point
forward and pushed down the ground to long on
leg stump, blocked forward
just outside off and Bopara tries to give himself room, gets it away on the off side
great shot, taken from outside off and really well timed behind square past deep square leg
dropped out on the off side and they scramble through, a direct hit would have been close
shorter and a shuffle back in the crease, cutting out to deep cover
off stump, forward and pushed past the left-hand of the bowler
full, on the stumps and a leading edge loops towards point
outisde off and Cook drives square into the deep
flat, on leg stump and chopped away like lumberjack by Bopara
flighted up, played hard into the ground to point
and looped outside off and cut finer but to the fielder
straighter but tickled to midwicket
steps out and punches just past the diving Afridi for one
room outside off and thrashes out towards deep extra cover
flighted on to the stumps and Cook is down quickly to sweep hard behind square
again swept towards deep backward square
hit into the off side
room outside off to cut but only succeeds in bottom edging into the ground and back to the bowler
full, loopy delivery and driven through extra cover
turned off the legs this time into the infield
floated outside off and pushed to extra cover
spots Bopara's advance and drags it flatter, pushed off the legs to midwicket
again Bopara skips out but has to jab the ball back to Malik, then scramble back to the crease
on the stumps and driven out to long-on
angled in and dragged towards deep square leg via an inside edge. Afridi has his head in his hands ...
there's not much room but Cook still rocks back and slams a cut away through point for four ...
and again, slashed hard through the off side. That's the hundred partnership up for the Essex boys, by the way
on off, Cook leans forward and plays to midwicket
checked drive from a full delivery but Afridi can't quite stop it sneaking by
plenty of room outside off and Bopara slashes like a horror film serial killer out towards deep backward point
pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off and played to point
room again and Cook cuts into the offside
forward and driven out to long-on
England continue to milk Malik, prodding another single down the ground
makes room for a dash but can't beat the man at cover-point

short and wide outside off and Cook crashes him to the square boundary. That's a third ODI hundred for the opener, and his second since taking the captaincy. Not that it'll quieten the critics, I would guess ...
floated up but Cook gets to the pitch and punches through midwicket
tighter line and played to the fielder at midwicket
an lbw shout, albeit a half-hearted one, as the ball slants into Cook and slide away off the pad towards long leg
pushed out to point
room to cut and a good diving stop at point can't prevent a run
on the batsman's legs and nudged out towards deep square leg, hard running yielding two
a better ball, full and on the stumps but Cook leans forward and drives to wide long-on
length and wide but only gets a toe end of the bat before running to extra-cover
full but not full enough and Cook lacerates a drive to the long-off boundary. He's cruising now
angled across and squeezed out to deep backward point
slower ball and Bopara chips it through the vacant mid-on area to reach a nicely played half-century - his seventh in ODIs
pacy, length delivery but Cook opens the arms and gets a thick edge that scuttles away to the boundary

out charges Ravi and off come the bails! Bit of a Coldplay moment there, but you can hardly expect England to bat through a Powerplay without at least one rush of blood to the head. He skipped out, played around a legside delivery and not even an Akmal couldn't muck that one up
straight and full, played back to the bowler
full again and Morgan throws out that back foot and launches the ball high over the infield, long-off chasing it down before the rope
tries to hoick it again but doesn't connect properly
outside off, pad thrust forward but the ball skids past
length ball, outside off, thick-edged all the way down to the third-man rope
outside off, angled across with a change of pace and misses with a hook
fuller, driven to the man at extra cover
drifted on to leg and chopped to midwicket, where Afridi sprawls on it like a lazy seagull
length, outside off and checked off the back foot straight to point
pitched outside leg before thumping into Morgan's knee roll - Gul and his team-mates appeal but nothing doing
tossed up on leg, batsman back and fiddles towards deep backward square
tight line, pushed to midwicket

hits the pad as Morgan misses with a reverse sweep and given out. Morgan goes for the review ... maybe on height, maybe because he thought it was going down leg. But it was doing neither and umpire Taufel raises his finger for the second time. Morgan's UAE struggles continue, then.
doosra tossed up outside leg, and edged in the opposite direction to fielder at point
tossed up again and blocked, a little uncertainly
on the stumps, defended
slanted across and thick-edged to the man at backward point
on the stumps, this time, and nudged around the corner
full - too full - and outside leg, allowing Kieswetter to squeeze a run out to deep square
good variation, slower and prodded to cover
looped up on leg and clipped into the deep
glanced to short backward point and they have to get a shift on to make the single
full and very wide, the drive is missed
driven off the toe to extra cover
back of a length, dropped into the off side, no-ball too, this isn't great so far...
slapped to long on from a length outside off
length, sliding past the attempted guide to third man
well bowled, length on off stump and it beats Kieswetter again
length outside off and cut to deep cover
full on off stump, front leg cleared and driven to cover
leg stump and pushed to deep square leg
full and driven to long off
full and guided to short third man, they scramble through
pushed through quicker and cut out to deep cover
back of a length and heaved out to the man at deep square
outside off and slides past the attempted late cut
full and down the pitch to drive in the air, no connection, and it falls in front of deep point
square drive and excellent running brings two as deep point comes to his right
well wide and signalled as such
dug out into the covers
Cook gets down and tries to play the ramp, misses and gets struck on the pad
slower ball bouncer - a useful tool well used - slapped to long on
length and cut to short third man
length outside leg and swept to deep square leg
great shot, taken from outside off as Cook's done a few times and swept with great timing to the deep square fence
length and cut out to deep square
straight up and caught. Kieswetter tried to give himself room to slog sweep outside leg but can only get a big top edge straight up in the air, easily taken from short third man
fired in to off stump, nudged down the ground to long on
full and dug out on off stump to deep square leg
full outside off and beating the attempted sort-of flick
length and blocked back to the bowler
leg side wide
full and driven out with a flick to deep cover
fine delivery, quick and a hint of reverse swing, Cook digs it out and it balloons up over the bowler
length and angled down wide of third man and they can take two
length outside off and slapped wide of long on

slider and Cook tries to sweep and misses, losing his leg stump. Pushed through quicker, the sweep has served Cook very well today but this time he got his front pad inside the line and it skidded past the pad into leg stump
Broad begins with a sweep and works it down to deep square leg
length on middle, nudged out into the off side from the crease

caught and bowled a fine take down low. Pushed through quicker again, Broad goes to drive, does so firmly and in the air back to Ajmal who bags the chance with two hands and claims another five-for against England
legside and strikes the pad
length outside off and driven to deep cover
back of a length, Swann looks to clip into the leg side, struck on the body, scrambles back after being sent back by Patel
length outside off and tucked away past point
step across the stumps and nicely clipped past midwicket, so well timed that it runs away to the fence, very good stroke
slapped over the top out to deep cover
full outside off and Patel tries to give himself room to drive over the off side, misses
length outside off and cut away through cover
full and squirted down to third man
length and opened the face to point, hit and gone but missed as the race through for a run
slower outside off and clubbed over Gul's head for a one-bounce four, a fine strike
whacked down the ground again, this time not timed, but they still come back for two
little bit of room outside off and slapped away again over backward point, another well timed stroke
excellent full delivery, just shaving the off stump through to the keeper, they decline the bye
leg stump, tried to be swung away, strikes the pad and they scramble through for a leg bye
full and freed the front leg to slap to long on
well wide of off stump and signalled so
great slower ball, does Swann completely, miles too soon over an attempted pull
there's the boundary, a thin nick from an attempted straight drive flies to the fine third man fence, no fielder near that
another slower ball to finish and again perfectly executed, doing Swann a treat, a good finish for Riaz

inn2.comm: full, straight and dug out to short extra-cover
shorter delivery, angled into the right-hander and turned into the ground on the on side
too far across this time and Hafeez whips it off his pads, the ball racing away just in front of square
it's quick, beating Hafeez for pace and thundering into the pads via, I think, an inside edge. There's half an appeal but Taufel shakes his head
good length, defended to the man at short midwicket
length ball, outside off and the batsman leaves
overpitched, a little swing back in but crunched straight down the ground - a well-timed stroke from Farhat
straighter line to the left-hander, nudged into the legside
length ball outside off, squares Hafeez up before whistling a few inches past the outside edge
loses his line, caught by Kieswetter down the legside
on the stumps, jabbed towards mid-on but can't get any pace on the shot
good length outside off, left
guided down to third man
Finn strikes early, beating Hafeez's chop and thumping into his pads. He was stuck on his crease and though he thought about reviewing, that looked pretty plumb

and another one! A similar ball, a touch fuller, seaming back into Shafiq's front pad. The bat was nowhere near the ball and he was rooted right in front of middle and off. Finn has started like a train!
length but left alone by Younis, who withdraws his bat
angled in and tucked into the legside
straight, good length, played into the ground on the onside
decent length once again and Farhat shows the maker's name
length outside off stump and pushed out to cover-point
this time angled back into the batsman, who defends into the onside
tip and run to cover
angled across, no movement but left alone
maintains a good length, defended back
played off the back foot towards extra cover, yells of 'no!' from the batsman
full delivery, plenty of room outside off and Younis steps out to larrup a cover drive away to the boundary. The locals toot their horns
shorter, seaming back a touch, and defended on to the wicket
length ball sails through as the batsman's leaves
wider but seaming back a touch again, Younis steps acriss and defends towards cover
straighter ball and turned off the hips, before some botched relay fielding in the deep leaves England looking a bit silly
nearly catches Farhet fishing outside off before whistling through to the keeper
goes back and plays the delivery down to third man
length delivery, defended into the offside
much fuller, this ball, and Farhat's eyes light up. The scoreboard doesn't exactly do the same, as extra-cover fields on the bounce
defensive shot back to the bowler
more width and Younis goes back before punching the ball out towards point
still no room for the left-hander and Farhat's drive is cramped, fielded by mid-off
shorter, slower, edged into his pads on the bounce
too full and Younis plays a classical straight drive past the bowler, beating the dive of mid-off. Hold the pose, sir
again deep into his crease to defend into the offside
still probing in the corridor, played off the back foot to point

gone - and that could be a crucial dismissal! And what a catch from Kieswetter! Finn perservered on that line outside off and again succeeded in bringing the ball back a wee bit ... Younis played slightly away from his front pad, snicked through and Kieswetter claimed to ball whilst diving full stretch to his left.
length ball outside off, no stroke
on the pads, tucked into the legside
no tempting Misbah outside off there - anothe leave
driven on the up to the man at cover
pitched up outside off and driven square, a well-timed stroke that brings the captain his first runs
still not quite the length from Broad, as Farhat punched the ball through the infield and out towards deep extra cover
too full and too roomy - Misbah seizes on it with relish and crashes a square drive away to the boundary
angled across and driven - but well stopped my mid-off
short, straight and forcing a back-foot defensive shot
pitched short again, angled in, deflected to short leg
still back of a length, clipped off the pads straight to midwicket

is that four for Finn? It is! That was unplayable, a silent assassin of a delivery that landed on middlle and screamed across Farhat's tentative push, taking a faint nick on its way through to Kieswetter. That was such a good ball, Farhat was unlucky to get anything on it!
pacy, length delivery and Umar has a windy, woolly whoosh at it
left alone outside off stump
shorter, seaming back but Misbah shoulders arms again
slightly back of a length, left alone once again
decent length, outside off again fails to tempt Misbah
steps forward, leaves (repeat)
straighter, on off, and defended back to the bowler
defended on off stump on a length
backfoot punch into the covers
full and driven into the covers and a sliding save from Bopara
left outside off
cracker again, length and nibbled at, great carry through to the keeper once more, highlighting Finn's pace
full and driven from the crease off an inside edge down to long leg
length on off stump and dropped into the off side
full outside off and driven to cover
cut away backward of point and Morgan comes across and does brilliantly to get down and make the save with one hand
pulled with a bit of a heave and a sliding save from Anderson at midwicket
punched off the back foot to mid off
driven up past cover but not timed well enough to take more than a single as mid off fields
full on middle and leg and tucked into the leg side
length ball on off stump and clipped down the ground to long off
fired in to leg stump and strikes the pad, beating the attempted leg side flick
tossed up on middle and leg and negotiated to long on
premeditated paddle sweep from a good length to deep square leg
length and Shafiq back and clipped to long on
full and driven to cover
driven again, this time down the ground to long off
length on off stump, blocked off the front foot into the off side
worked from a full length down to long leg
full and easily driven to long off
more runs, opening the face to third man
full on off stump and blocked back to the bowler
flatter, again on off stump, punched off the back foot to the bowler
reverse sweep, a touch ungainly, to short third man

oh gone! Patel has slid one past the inside edge, onto the back pad and the Pakistan captain has to go, lbw again! It was a regulation full length ball on middle and off and quite simply, Misbah has missed it completely. A very surreal dismissal. The TV commentators assumed their was some bat involved and Misbah would refer but not to be. He's plumb and gone.
full on off stump and blocked
driven into the off side
length and an inside edge saves Shafiq from another lbw
length and blocked on off stump
leg stump and whipped with a flourish to Swann at long leg
back of a length and played up on the toes into the leg side
full on off stump and defended from the crease
length and pushed off the back foot into the leg side, Broad slides and saves at mid on
full and outside off, left alone
terrible stroke, poking at a back of a length ball outside off, missed
forward just about and pushed into the covers
length outside off and left alone
another lbw it's carnage. This is reviewed but he hasn't hit it but he's saved by being outside the line...enough of a gap too...
back of a length and tucked into the leg side
bit of width and hammered away, great shot, laying into the wide length ball and well placed past point
length and much closer to the off stump, blocked from the crease
back of a length and blocked on off stump
back of a length again and tucked into the leg side
length and pushed to mid off
heaved away from a full length over midwicket, Patel can't get round from deep square leg
length and pushed forward into the covers
length and played forward into the covers
length outside off and left
length and played forward into the leg side
forward on off stump and blocked up to mid on
full on off stump and punched to mid on
there's a bit of intent, lofted drive over mid on, no real connection, it lands well inside the rope and not too far from a retreating Broad
leg side wide
step to leg and a smash to cover from a length off middle stump
back of a length and now pulled to midwicket
trapped on the crease, huge cry for lbw, not out and no review, probably too high, hit well above the knee roll
opened up the front leg and bang! Down the ground but a great diving save by Broad, great work with the right hand prevents any runs, fine effort
tossed up, played out to mid-on

that's a shocker! Malik has a yahoo at a full-bunger and completely mistimes it, the ball looping gently to the man standing at mid-on. I think it hit the toe end of the bat - pressure telling there, and Patel has spooked another.
shorter, driven to mid-off
on the stumps, Umar gets down to sweep
tossed up again and Afridi paddles the ball over his shoulder down to fine leg
flatter ball, driven down to long on
tossed up, struck back down the ground
given some air and here comes Shahid! He skips out and bangs a full-blooded, aerial drive for a one-bounce four to long-on
flighted up again, even slower and defended
on the stumps and again Afridi skips out, driving over mid-off
off stump and turning in, tucked to square leg
worked into the leg side but quickly fielded
length ball, outside off, defended back
quicker, in that danger area and with a scrambled seam - Umar misses with a uneasy prod
angled in and tucked square on the leg side
shorter ball and bounce surprises Afridi, who wears the ball on his body
dropped sharply into the on side but with Afridi setting off quickly, Umar turns him down. Afridi looks quizzical, definitely a little miffed
short delivery but worked out to cover
flat, landing on a length outside off, worked to short midwicket
given more air, Afridi prances down the wicket but screws his shot into the ground and out to long-off
flighted up and pushed out into the covers
goes down on one knee to manufacture a sweep from well outside off
flatter, quicker ball and Umar can only steer it back to Swann
driven back to the bowler again from outside off stump
short and with room to cut outsdie off but Anderson gets around well from third man to make the stop and Patel returns the ball swiftly
length delivery, back and punched through the gap in the covers to again give Patel some work to do in the deep
back and across to flick the ball off his pads square of the wicket
short and forcing Umar back, defended on to the wicket
pitched up a wee bit more and Umar misses with an almighty slug
room outside off and played off the face to third man
back and driven to mid-off
floated towards the blockhole and driven into the ground
on the stumps, steps across and hoicks an agricultural sweep over his shoulder out to long leg

and dropped! Afridi has a huge mow and it looks for all the world that it'll be six ... but these are long boundaries and it drops right into Samit Patel's bread basket. Unfortunately, it hits an uneaten loaf, or something, and pops straight back out. Swann is fuming.

ah, now he'll be a bit chirpier. An arm ball (or maybe one that just doesn't turn) goes past Umar's outside edge and Kieswetter whips off bails. Umpire Ahsan Raza doesn't need a replay, he was that far out of his crease ... Oh, Umar!
given some air and defended down the wicket
lofted up and crunched on the drive ... straight to extra cover
slower ball but Afridi picks up, steps away, makes himself a cup of tea and lasers a cover drive through the infield
and again! Tossed up on the stumps and Boom Boom opens his shoulders to slam another four through the off side
fired in just down the leg side, missing Afridi's sweep and going through Kieswetter's legs for extra wides
the party's over for Afridi, who slaps a slog straight to long-off. It went flat and hard but was a comfortable enough catch. We all know Afridi has a big sword - and there he died by it.
outside off, turning some way back to hit the front pad ... Swann thinks this is out and England review the not out decision. No, Gul got himself outside the line there, so umpire Raza's call stands
outside off, pushed to cover
good length, outside off, turning to hit the pad
tight line, defended back to the bowler
spinning back sharply and Gul shoulders arms. A big appeal - but again there was doubt about how much it would come back
played into the on side - that's a maiden
defended back to the bowler
played off the legs to backward square
flighted outside off, played off the back foot towards mid-wicket
taken from outside off towards square
shorter, outside off and Gul goes back to punch the ball into the on side, where Morgan attempts a diving stop
length ball, played back and to mid-on without much pace

the end is nigh ... Gul again plays around a delivery turning into him. He goes for the review ... but this time it hit him just in line with off stump and there's no reprieve. England, quite remarkably, are on the brink of a crushing victory.
tossed up, defended outside off
again prodding forward into the offisde
flatter ball but Riaz gets behind it with a forward defensive
flighted more, misses with a huge slog sweep but Kieswetter can't take it cleanly
goes back to push a defensive shot into the off side
length, defended to cover
quicker, targeting the batsman, who fences and misses as the ball flies over off stump
length ball and Ajmal plays away from his body, defending to extra cover
drifts on to leg but the batsman fails to connect. Runs away towards short leg
fuller, tempting the drive but beats everything
length delivery, defended into the off side and fielded by Finn
defended on off stump
given a bit more flight, attempted sweep to leg
outside off and Ajmal gets forward
again tossed up but Ajmal eschews an attacking stroke
flatter, harder, targeting the stumps but somehow the attempted sweep keeps it out
presses forward diligently and defends the stumps
beaten outside off
length ball, but still no swinging. Are these really Pakistan tailenders?
continues to probe outside off and Riaz misses with a push
bit shorter, bit quicker and Riaz again sticks with a back-foot prod. Twist, man, twist!
straighter, but blocked back to the bowler
ooh, that's a bit lively! Finn looses off a beamer that Riaz ducks under and Kieswetter can't get to. So, one more chance to get his fifth wicket and finish this off
on leg and dobbled out to midwicket
length ball, defended (groans)
more room outside off and Wahab has a swing, getting a single to deep midwicket area
tossed up, defended back
again probing outside off and the drive finds extra -over
maintains the line and driven - superb diving stop from Broad keeps the damage down
turning in from around off, tucked towards short square leg
outside off, pushed into the covers
drops short and belted baseball-style for a one-bounce four over long-on. That's more like it
short, fast, left alone outside off
targeted at the batsman's body, who flips it towards deep square leg
dropping short and Ajmal swivels to execute a somewhat ungainly pull. More tailender batting, please!

thank you! Ajmal top edges a pull and captain Cook runs around from mid-on to claim the catch at mid-off, almost colliding with a team-mate in the process. The last-wicket malingering comes to an end after 17 runs in almost six overs and England have won. Hark at that!
